Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: purplechic25
Reviews.Content: I repeat, do not stay here. There was a hole where the linoleum had pulled off the cement and you could see straight down to the cement. It was about one foot around. The heat was lousy. The desk clerk was hostile. I think having an intact floor is not too much to ask, even from a cheap hotel. I'm not sure I ever want to take a chance on a Motel 6 again.

Reviews.Title: “If you dont mind being grounded to your room after 8pm by an armed security guard, welcome home.”
Reviews.Author: mlth0mas
Reviews.Content: I'm a 41 yr old man and have spent the last 3+ yrs traveling over 300 days a year staying in Motels all over the country. On this stay my 61yr old mom and her 75 yr old husband also rented a room here so we could spend the weekend visiting. On Saturday night 4/2/2011 the three of us were sitting outside their bottom floor room enjoying the spring night talking at about 9pm. We were not drinking or loud nor did any other guests call to complain about noise but none the less an armed security guard approached us and told us to take our chairs inside that we were not allowed to sit outside after 8pm. Now don't get this wrong, I understand the hotel not wanting people drinking and raising hell at all hours of the night in fact I don't want that either. And I like the fact they have security to keep my car safe and break up any wild parties but being treated like a child and sent to my room at 9 oclock is no way to treat a paying well behaved customer. The pool area was locked and there were no other places where guests could sit outside and talk except right outside the room so if its a safety thing and has something to do with potentially obstructing the sidewalk they need to provide a place for guest to sit outside when the pool is closed for the season. The security guard with the Gun was very polite but this rule is a deal breaker for me and I will never stay here again and will think twice before staying at another motel 6. I have never had anything like this happen anywhere else but 1 bad apple will spoil the whole bushel and from this day forward motel 6 is tarnished in my mind.

Reviews.Title: “cockroaches all over”
Reviews.Author: bessnphil
Reviews.Content: This was the worst motel I have ever stayed in. Dirty. Food left behind bed was the cause of roaches in the bedroom. Dead roaches in kitchen area. The bed was dirty with hardened staines on the blanket and quilt. Save your money and find another place. I needed to use the laundy, but with live roaches all over the room, I couldn't.

Reviews.Title: “Take Your Money and Find Someplace Else”
Reviews.Author: BigBear63
Reviews.Content: This hotel had serious issues. I told the lady I needed a quiet room. Seems there is no such thing in this hotel. They moved me to another room which ended up not being any better. The first room had 2 rooms next door to it that were being used by guys who had their doors open all the time, watching the street for whoever might be driving by. Wonder what kind of business they are running? The other room they gave me had noisy neighbors as well. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: antq
Reviews.Content: Just OK. It seems the air conditioning (central, not a below-window unit) had been turned off for the winter, and the filter needed changing. It had one of those small, round, leaky showers I dislike. The room was clean, desk help friendly, ice machine working....but the rate was too high, and all the area hotels (8 or so) had blocked their wifi access, so we were unable to get online.

Reviews.Title: “Bates Motel”
Reviews.Author: hackjenn
Reviews.Content: We stopped in off the interstate on our way to New Orleans we just needed a place to stop and sleep, but this place violated some major health code violations i am sure, When I walked in there was a girl at the front desk with a Tattoo across her neck, and shady characters hanging around. and i thought to myself this is just one night and we wil be out in the morning. when we got to the room and pulled back to covers, there was "body hair" under the sheets and dried blood on the back of the comforter. Needless to say i was out the door and back to the front office, where it took and act ofcongress to get my money back. DO NOT stay here. so we drove down into Mississippi and found a nice days inn in Hernando Mississippi

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: khyren
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here twice last week, as a stopover on a long road trip. We had made reservations in advance. As expected with a cheaper motel, the place was full of seedy looking characters just hanging out in the parking lot or leaning over the rails. There is security on the premises that monitor the parking lot, so that was a plus. However, I did not feel safe enough to ever stay there with a child again. We would have switched hotels, but there was a convention in town and no other rooms were open. The room was exceptionally tiny, which was also expected for the price. The place was just old and worn out. The sinks in both rooms we stayed in were cracked and covered in cigarette burns (non-smoking rooms), as was the floor, which was also covered in suspicious looking yellow stains around the toilet. The carpets were noticably dirty in the corners and by the bed. The second time through when we arrived there was no one to check us in. We waited a half hour and were about to leave and try the next town when the desk clerk finally arrived. The beds were comfortable, the tv worked, and the wake-up call was on time. It's an OK place to just sleep. As the title says, you get what you pay for, just know what that $20 or so you save are really costing you. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: bjeffor1
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here after a night at the La Quinta Airport in Memphis, which was horrible. This place was typical Motel 6. It had a nice pool and was quiet. But more important it looked a lot safer than the La Quinta. Only problem we had here was the air conditioner kept dripping water onto the floor and we had to get a towel to cover the puddle. Other than that we enjoyed it and would stay here again if we needed to. It's out of the way though (about 15 minutes east of downtown) so would prefer something closer in to the city next time.

HotelInfo.Name: Motel 6 Memphis East
HotelInfo.Address: 1321 Sycamore View Rd, Memphis, TN 38134
